results.title: Search for the Battleship Bismarck
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, Christine Weber and Peter Schnall
results.brief_description: National Geographic looks back at the first - and last- mission of the Bismarck, sunk on May 27, 1941 with a loss of more than 2,000 lives. Narrated by Richard Kiley, they talk with survivors of the notorious World War II battle, and reveals exclusive footage of the remarkable exploration for the sunken ship 600 miles off the coast of France.

results.title: Search for security
results.creator_credit: Zanthus Films, Victoria. Hospitals and Charities Commission, Jennie Blackwood and Adrian Boddington
results.brief_description: A presentation of the problems facing the aged and the community’s responsibility to them. Shows through the experiences of one elderly lady (played by Lorna Forbes) the services rendered by social workers, district nurses, and “meals on wheels”. Emphasises need for companionship, warmth and comfort, as well as a degree of independence.

results.title: Search for oil
results.brief_description: ‘Search for oil’ explains some of the work involved in oil exploration prior to drilling wells. The technology is becoming increasingly complex as the search becomes more difficult, but the story is told in a simple way using interesting images from around the world with basic non-technical animated drawings. It incorporates examples of the latest advances in the field of seismic exploration.

results.title: Search for identity
results.brief_description: Presents the history of a former Cobb and Co coach house on the Old Sydney Road at Avenel in Central Victoria, from its early days in the 1850s to the present. Explores methods of research showing various techniques used to reconstruct the building’s history: visits to the Central Plans Office, Titles Office and Avenel Cemetery; and an examination of the building’s structure. Narrated bhy John Stanton.

results.title: Search for happiness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Shows how the stresses and strains of modern living lead to many unhappy people seeking advice from radio counsellors, newspaper columnists, and fortune tellers.

results.title: Search for a link
results.brief_description: A documentary that examines the hypothesis that the human mind can influence the body’s defences. Experts are now testing to see if there is a link between certain personalities and the susceptibility to cancer. Researchers, in this field, discuss their experiments, and whether there is such a thing as a “cancer personality”.

results.title: Search and research: an impression of the building research establishment
results.creator_credit: Rayant Pictures, John Durst and Tom Williamson
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the Building Research Establishment, which provides a technical advisory service for the construction industry both in the U.K. and overseas. Shows some of the Establishment’s projects, including the detailed study of building materials, research into the environmental aspects of the growth of new towns, and the study of resources to improve the utilisation of building materials and labour.

results.title: Search and rescue
results.creator_credit: RGA Films, Film Australia, Peter Johnson and Rob McAuley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Explains the ways in which search and rescue can be facilitated should the crew in distress observe certain basic procedures. Cast includes Tony Barry, patrick Bollen, Bob Mercer.

results.title: Search and privacy
results.brief_description: Presents realistic contemporary situations to illustrate the problems surrounding the conflict between efficient law enforcement and the right of the individual to be free from unreasonable searches and invasion of privacy. Illustrations are related to the Fourth Amendment of the American Bill of Rights. Made for discussion purposes. Suitable for secondary level.
